results.title: Without prejudice
results.brief_description: The facts about epilepsy are contrasted with popular misconceptions. The theme is the need for unbiased attitudes towards people with epilepsy. Children who have epilepsy are shown talking about their problems. The effect that public ignorance has on people with epilepsy is clearly illustrated.
results.description: The facts about epilepsy are contrasted with popular misconceptions. The theme is the need for unbiased attitudes towards people with epilepsy. results.title: Without love = Bez milosci [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Barbara Sass, Iluzjon Film Unit and Zespoly Filmowe
results.brief_description: Pill-popping reporter Ewa Bracka (Dorota Stalinska), needs her uppers to fuel her all-consuming non-stop attempts at getting “the story”. Her determination to be a top journalist has no boundaries - cynical, ruthless, unethical, and unscrupulous, Ewa is prepared to sleep her way to the top. As Ewa herself says “The object of life is to live. To have it all and at any price”. Ewa is a single parent, living in Warsaw with her young daughter (the result of an affair whilst in Rome). With the help and support of her mother in caring for her daughter, Ewa is able to pursue her career, take up judo lessons and maintain the odd affair or two. Ewa believes in the issue, but has no time for the people, innocent or guilty, whom she may expose in getting her story on to the front page. That is until she meets and befriends Marianna, a young girl who lives and works in a local brothel. Through Marianna, Ewa is finally forced to confront her own demons. Cast includes Wladyslaw Kowalski, Malgorzata Zajaczkowska, Zdzislaw Wardejn, Emilian Kaminski, Jadwiga Polanowska, Malgorzata Pritulak. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Within these city walls
results.brief_description: Today in the old German cities we can still meet the Middle Ages. Through their buildings, pictures and documents we can trace the history of their growth, the expansion of trade and development of craftsmanship. The proud and beautiful buildings of medieval cities and towns are a memento of their struggle for liberty and municipal independence.

results.title: With hand and heart
results.creator_credit: Yang Seung Ryong and United States Information Service (Seoul, Korea)
results.brief_description: Story of a Korean amputee, hopelessly depressed after losing his arms in the Korean War and fully dependent upon his family; his rehabilitation after he enters the Amputee Centre in Taejon, sponsored and financed by the American Church World Service, where he is given artificial arms and therapy leading to restoration of faith in himself. Finally he attends the Rural Institute where he is taught improved farming techniques.

results.title: With a little friendly help
results.creator_credit: Brian Benson and Department of Commercial and Industrial Development Queensland
results.brief_description: Queensland’s Department of Industrial Development (DID) assists the development and production of innovation by establishing industrial estates. This film surveys the estates in Queensland and highlights some of the industries supported on these.

results.title: Winter 1929: de Stadhuis-Brand te Leiden. Ijmuiden, 29 April 1930: wereld's grootste ships Geopend
results.brief_description: Winter 1929 - footage of firefighting, showing the use of heavy hosing. Water icing over in buildings in the middle of winter after putting fires out. Ijmuiden 29th April 1930 - footage of dams and huge water reservoir and steamship docking from the Netherlands with a caption about the “Johan Van Oldenbarmetelt” with the Kooninklijke family on board.
results.title_for_label: Winter 1929: de Stadhuis-Brand te Leiden. Ijmuiden, 29 April 1930: wereld’s grootste ships Geopend

results.title: Winter
results.brief_description: Animation about a snow covered mountain village threatened by a large menacing stranger. Normal village activities are stopped while the villagers band together to drive him away.

results.title: Winning public support
results.brief_description: Looks at the setting up a rapid transit system in San Francisco and the actions of the various county councils involved. Examines the roles of individuals within these organizations, their interactions and different levels of power, and influence in participating in this scheme.
results.description: Looks at the setting up a rapid transit system in San Francisco and the actions of the various county councils involved. results.title: Winemakers to the world
results.brief_description: Winemaking in Australia. Amongst the new settlers coming to Adelaide in 1844 was Dr Penfold who was to establish the largest winemaking business in the British Empire. Founded in the Barossa Valley, it has branches in Griffith, the Hunter Valley, and Minchinbury. Latest machinery and up-to-date scientific knowledge combine to produce world class wines, which are bottled at Tempe, New South Wales. Champagne, claret, brandy and sherries have a world wide market.

results.title: Wind erosion
results.creator_credit: Gerry North and Western Australia. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Western Australia, with its history of strong winds in late summer and early winter, is recognised as the wind state in Australia. Records show that the majority of our already fragile agricultural soils are severely eroded by strong winds on average every five years. Changes in cropping practices and the provision of adequate vegetation cover will minimise wind erosion losses and improve productivity.
